thread.title: Fantasy picks: Studs and duds for Week 5
thread.title_full: Fantasy picks: Studs and duds for Week 5 | Boston Herald

author: Tyler Sullivan
title: Fantasy picks: Studs and duds for Week 5
text:
Who to play, who to bench in your lineup this week:
Studs
Giants QB Eli Manning vs. 49ers — Eli hasn’t thrown for major yardage totals, but he has made up for it with TD passes. He should carve up San Fran’s secondary.
Ravens RB Justin Forsett vs. Browns — With Steve Smith Sr. out, the Ravens will run the ball more often. Browns defense has given up the second most rushing yards this season.
Buccaneers RB Doug Martin vs. Jaguars — The Muscles Hamster has been hit or miss this season, but in Week 5 against a soft Jags team, he should have a big game.
Falcons WR Leonard Hankerson vs. Redskins — If you haven’t noticed, Hankerson has jumped right over Roddy White in the dangerous ATL passing game.
Browns WR Travis Benjamin at Ravens — Baltimore is strong vs. the run, but not as sturdy in the passing game. This game could turn into a shootout.
Chargers TE Antonio Gates vs. Steelers — He’s baaack and has great timing going up against a tight end friendly Pittsburgh defense. Duds
Bengals QB Andy Dalton vs. Seahawks — He’s been the second best player in fantasy football, but you should sit Dalton this week. He’s due for a stinker and it smells like this week.
Lions RB Ameer Abdullah vs. Cardinals — He’s had the misfortune of facing tough defenses, and the trend continues for at least one more week.
Patriots RB LeGarrette Blount at Cowboys — Don’t let the three touchdowns before the bye week fool you. This is Dion Lewis’ backfield.
Rams WR Tavon Austin at Packers — He deserves a roster spot, but let’s see if he can string a few good games along before giving him a starting job.
Raiders WR Amari Cooper vs. Broncos — He’s probably been your best receiver, but going up against the fantasy killing Denver defense I’d bench him.
